content:
Plan for Messaging for In-App and Web

Before configuring a messaging experience, consider your organizationâ€™s current support goals. This step helps you select the right Omni-Channel routing, pre-chat form fields, and custom parameters to personalize the experience.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience.

Planning Questions

To create an effective messaging system for a support team, answer these three questions.

How are your agents organized?
What details do they need before chatting with a customer?
Where do agents pull Salesforce records before connecting with a customer?

Considerations and Messaging Options

Agents organized
One group
Service type
Skill set
Support topics
Languages

Match segment for Omni routing type
Routing with Queues
Route to an Agent
Routing with Skills
Routing with Bots

Details agents need
First name
Last name
Email
Custom information

Use the pre-chat form
Collect details at the point of contact. Ask customers to fill out visible pre-chat fields or collect data behind-the-scenes with hidden pre-chat fields.

Records pulled
Leads
Cases
Contacts

Feature Checklist

User verification allows messaging conversations to persist beyond a single interaction, and across tabs and devices.
Pre-chat forms use visible and hidden fields to collect basic details and other essential information like an email address.
Bots ease the messaging burden on your agents for routine requests.

Object lookup and creation added to your Omni Flow provides agents with customer records as leads, cases, or contacts, so they have everything they need at their fingertips.

Branding, yes! You can customize the look and feel of your messaging experience for mobile and web channels.
Custom Labels can match the voice and tone of your website.
Messaging Components let you send structured content to customers for a more interactive and efficient messaging experience.

Push notifications for your mobile channel are an effective way to stay in touch with customers.
title: Plan and Configure Messaging for Service Cloud
